paragraph.paragraph:
A explicit cluster folder's properties are accessible from the Visual Studio .NET
ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfPropertyBrowser.htm properties window . To view the properties window:
Select a cluster folder in your EiffelEnvision ../../../structure/project.xmlProject.
Choose View, Properties menu.
The properties window may also been shown for any selected item by pressing the F4 keyboard shortcut or by choosing Properties from a explicit cluster folder's context menu.

Cluster Name
The unique name of the cluster in a project, how it appears in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htm Solution Explorer .
This property cannot be empty and must contain only alphanumerical characters and underscores ('_').
This property is read-only when library_cluster Library Cluster is set to Yes.

Excluded Items
A semi-colon (';') delimited list of excluded project items. These will typically be
../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/items/eiffel_classes.xml Eiffel Class File Items and
../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xml Cluster Folders .
Recommended: It is recommended that you excluded items via the item itself. For information on how to achieve this, see ../../item_exclusion.xml Including and Excluding Project Items .
This property is read-only when library_cluster Library Cluster is set to Yes.

Include Subdirectories
Indicates if all subdirectories located under the cluster's pathPath should be included when ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_enumeration.xml enumerating the cluster at compilation time. Setting this property to No will only include the ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/items/eiffel_classes.xml Eiffel classes found directly under the cluster's pathPath. Setting to Yes will include all ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/items/eiffel_classes.xml Eiffel classes and subdirectories.
This property is read-only when library_cluster Library Cluster is set to Yes.

Library Cluster
Indicates if the cluster is a library cluster for compile-time optimizations. When set to Yes the Eiffel for .NET compiler will examine the cluster only once, unless a ../../../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xml Rebuild is performed. Any future modifications will be ignored by the compiler. In addition, a number of other explicit cluster properties will become disabled to indicate that the changes will not be effective.
Note: Due to the nature of library marked clusters, when set to Yes the cluster will act as if
include_subdirectories Include Subdirectories has been set to Yes also.

Override
This property is to resolve class name conflicts when including multiple clusters. It specifies that the Eiffel compiler should give priority to any contained Eiffel ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml class classes over any other clusters classes with conflicting class names.
This property is read-only when library_cluster Library Cluster is set to Yes.

Path
The path to a folder on disk that contains Eiffel ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml class class source files you would like to include in your project. ../../environment_variables.xml Environment Variables may be used in paths to promote portability.
This property is read-only when library_cluster Library Cluster is set to Yes.

Full Namespace
The namespace that will be used to qualify all contained Eiffel ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml classes . This property is based on the ../general.xml cluster_namespace_format Cluster Namespace Format project configuration property and it's casing determined by the ../general.xml dotnet_naming_convention .NET naming convention project configuration property.

Namespace
This property is used to specify an alternative namespace when using one of the ../general.xml cluster_namespace_format Cluster Namespace Format property to generate namespace for explicit clusters.
Note: When specifying and alternative namespace ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xml Explicit Cluster Folders that are subclusters of another ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xml Explicit Cluster Folder will not compound the parent cluster's namespace to the specified namespace.
This property is read-only when library_cluster Library Cluster is set to Yes.

Discard Assertions for Optimization
Indicates that the build process should discard any specified assertions when the ../build.xml optimize_code Optimize Code build property is set to Yes.

Use Project Assertions
Indicates if the defined project level ../assertions.xml Assertion Properties should be used instead of any locally defined assertions (see below properties).

Evaluate Checks
Indicates check assertions will be evaluated for all classes located under the explicit cluster and any ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlsubcluster folders.
This property is read-only when use_project_assertions Use Project Assertions is set to Yes.

Evaluate Invariants
Indicates class invariants assertions will be evaluated for all classes located under the explicit cluster and any ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlsubcluster folders.
This property is read-only when use_project_assertions Use Project Assertions is set to Yes.

Evaluate Loops
Indicates loop assertions will be evaluated for all classes located under the explicit cluster and any ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlsubcluster folders.
This property is read-only when use_project_assertions Use Project Assertions is set to Yes.

Evaluate Postconditions
Indicates ensure assertions will be evaluated for all classes located under the explicit cluster and any ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlsubcluster folders.
This property is read-only when use_project_assertions Use Project Assertions is set to Yes.

Evaluate Preconditions
Indicates require assertions will be evaluated for all classes located under the explicit cluster and any ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlsubcluster folders.
This property is read-only when use_project_assertions Use Project Assertions is set to Yes.
